column2: On Feb 18, 2024, at 6:33 PM, Chasarik, Krisann <Krisann.Chasarik@abc.com> wrote:
A bit of a crash at the top of the 5pm.

Minutes before the broadcast began, engineering was doing some work remotely on graphics channel four, G4, as a late fullscreen graphic was being filed. This is believed to have locked up G3. As the director was running through the show, he noticed that after every stinger, a blank fullscreen graphic would air. Rich Tom and the director tried to pinpoint the problem. In addition, when we went to Spencer his mic was not working. Director tested mic minutes before and it was working. Director made some last-minute adjustments, but the frozen fullscreen graphic in G3 made it on air, and the director could not get off of it. We went to break.
Please, can we not do any testing/work on a system during a newscast that could affect said newscast unless it is absolutely necessary.
A31  PRES DAY CLOSURES - ½ Fullscreen went to black on air. Cause unknown. Worked after testing
B5  EAST BAY stinger failed to play

Thanks to everyone for helping with the breaking news coverage on the avalanche!

There was some miscommunication between our side & DC3 about what the plan was for staying in continuing coverage. This led to them cutting us off when we had intended to stay on air. Also, there was some confusion with the stream, which stayed on the Oakland officer's funeral.
That eventually got ironed out & we stayed on linear until approximately 12:20ish.

Subject: 2/3pm Oakland Hills Fire Breaking News

Anchor 2 button on the right PL panel in PC3 got stuck multiple times. It also didn't work several times when I tried to talk to Kristen so I would have to relay things through Karina or Chris would have to talk to her. Extremely frustrating during breaking news. When I switched to the left PL panel and I was able to communicate with everyone and things went much smoother. Overall things looked great. We got on the air a little after 2PM and did not take a break. 3PM and World News did not air due to our continuing coverage.

column2: Producers, please do not file the countdown bug to a rundown.
The director will recall the countdown bug using Overdrive.
The countdown bug has been assigned a Fixed ID which Overdrive uses to recall the graphic.
When a Fixed ID graphic is deleted, floated, or MOS Deactivated all graphics with that Fixed ID are removed from the system.
There should be only one instance of Fixed ID graphic at a time.
Fixed ID CGs are filed to the Saturday, Dalet OD XPression rundown.

RE: 6pm discrep,"Just wanted to clarify that the issues on today’s 6pm were operational, not technical.

The cold open was of a kind that I had yet to attempt. There were issues with it that I did not have time to solve in the seven or so minutes leading up to the show. I now know what prevented it from working and will share that with my fellow directors in tomorrow morning’s Zoom call.
A few problems off the top - kudos to Chris for running through the show as soon as he got control in PC3 and identifying issues which we tried to fix.

A10 COLD OPEN - Planned for a 3M monitor on cam with a lower third, but the 3M graphic didn't display. Tried changing the lower third from cold open to regular banner but that didn't resolve the issue. Tried turning the 3M MOC-FS into a VO clip (the aircheck was already ingesting and I edited in the booth). Recoded in a hurry and didn't get to run through it. Realized at the end of the preshow that the cold open still wasn't going to air correctly so we came out to the 2shot instead.
Because we spent several minutes troubleshooting the cold open, we were unable to run through the show and prevent the following issues:
A16 LIBERTY MUTUAL INT - graphic didn't display in the TRAFR monitor. Fixed for the tag.

A23 WHITE HOUSE HOUSING INT - video was not seen in the BAM because it hadn't been routed back to normal. BAM had been left on a powerpoint presentation. This was for an INTD SPLIT reporter shot. Zoomed into just the INTL for the tag.
Also, several times the anchors commented that their iPads were not updating scripts.
6 PM Producer, KGO-TV | ABC7 Bay Area

D10: Full screen did not show content upon bringing up the graphic, learned that the 'reveal' object/field also has a blank setting that can be turned on. That will in turn not bring up any content. Good note for anyone who builds these in the future to always check that setting. Especially if you reset the graphic by selecting ""revert all fields to template values.""

RE: 5PM Discrepancy Report,"After the 5p show, engineering troubleshot the Dalet issue.  While troubleshooting the issue, we were able to determine that the Dalet MOS Services were in a bad state.  Shows were MOS’d off and the Dalet MOS Services were restarted.  Once the Dalet MOS Services were running, the shows were MOS’d on again in Dalet to bring the Control Rooms functioning at 5:50p.

Dalet system failure led to many changes on the fly. Producer floated a late package about three minutes before it was slated to air. The change did not take in prompter, and director's Dalet did not reflect the change. I had anchors toss to break.
Producer lost all control of Dalet at 5:14 and lost the ability to time the show or make any rundown changes.
Anchors and director did a good job adjusting to the changes and executing the rest of the newscast without control of Dalet.
Engineering worked to correct the issue which appears to have been resolved for the 6PM.

Re: 9am show report 7/7,"Report from DC3, boils down to wrong control room on the schedule for the tease.
:43 of black on air during term break of This Week. News Tease was scheduled on PCR3 at 08:58:57 instead of PCR2. Delay caused the 9am news to start :28 later than scheduled.

Note: Operator reached out to station to tell them they were hot and rolled term when they did not get a response. When operator informed station that he had rolled the break, they informed us that they never got the tally to tell them they were on. Tally was on PCR3, not PCR2 where tease was coming from. News started late at 09:01:10
Operator rolled term break manually and gave station new start time of 9am news.

RE: 4:30pm Discrepancy Report,"After the show we tested different opens into the FS. It appears Opens into FS do not work. The FS worked, the open worked just not back to back. Sadly because this was a last minute change due to breaking news getting shuffled around there was no time to test the combination.

Cascade of issues at the top of the show. Our live cam of the GG Bridge accident moved two minutes before the top of the show and could not be moved back in time. I floated it and brought up the Sonoma Co earthquake to the top. When we cued the FS map following the open, it went to black. We went to the VO and then came out on cam, then re-cued the VO as scripted.

3PM Getting Answers Discrepancy Report,"Report Type: Producer

There was a curse word on one of the clips for OAK GAZA PROTEST. The clip had been replaced before the show, but did not land on all of the brios (specifically, did not hit brio 8). So, the clip that was there prior was still cued up & aired (briefly). As soon as we saw it, Kurt advanced off the clip.
Slight miscommunication with Cornell had him tossing to soundbites out of order. But Kurt played them back-to-back & Cornell rolled with it on the fly.
NOTE: I DID HAVE TO DROP BREAKS 2 & 3 because we got the CHP news conference in the middle of the show.
We got out on time to go to World News.
THANK YOU everyone for being flexible & for pitching in today. It is much appreciated!

- We took a pkg too early and cut out of it early. Prompter also crashed.

I had a problem with the set up for the 5 and 7 this morning in PC3. An error “could not prepare shot because: No re-entry crosspoint found for”  was showing up on both set ups. Once I passed this error in the 5 the newscast was fine. However the 7 was a mess since I’m running the set up during the open…""

The wrong videos aired in the preshow. Director determined he needed to double-click any/all clips in order for the right video to cue up. So that is what he had to do for the entire A block in order for the right video clips to air (the first click, the wrong video cued up. the second click, the correct video cued up everytime). Director switched to the backup server during break 1 and the issue was solved.  At this point, I am not sure why this occurred and engineering has been called to determine the root of the problem but I have not heard back.

Re: 5P & 530P SHOW REPORT 3/26,"The problem came up again prepping for the 11pm promo. It turns out, the Anch(_L) microphone was muted on the virtual audio console.  It wouldn't have mattered if Dan was on the 5p or the regular Anchor mic.  Most likely it was muted during an earlier show to avoid mic interference.
The 5pm show was the first time that microphone was used in PC2 on the afternoon shift. Not much time between the 4 and 5 to find and correct this.
We will be better collectively to restore the room to its default settings upon leaving... and know what to look out for in the future.

RE: 6am show report 3/6,"C5- Went to FS instead of BTI FS (and FS couldn't load when we tried to go back)
The script for C5 called to advance to Fullscreen, which was next (C7) in the rundown.
A suggestion in the future would be to refer to election graphics as a source other than
“Fullscreen,” since a Fullscreen is something different entirely than the BTI election graphics.
The line used for E46 was copied into the rundown from a live hit\Toolkit, and as described in the text that was copied, it kills all audio that isn’t the Nemo audio described within the line.
Suggestion: Create new lines, and not copy & paste..
Exact same scenario and solution as E46
C5- Went to FS instead of BTI FS (and FS couldn't load when we tried to go back)
7 things had yesterday's scripts pasted in so we had to scramble to get out of them.

A45 HOW TO VOTE FS - ghost float in the graphic from the line before (THANKS JR BOXES) caused this fullscreen not to show up. Sat on the next element during the whole read.
B15 MAIN WEATHER - Phil walked in front of the chromakey while it was hot.
D12 MODERN VOTING - ghost float in the graphic from the line before (THANKS ZACH BOXES) caused us to jump over the oncam intro and go straight to VO. Went back on cam, then went back to Vo.

column2: A4 HELLO: Anchors out of position for the top of the newscast. They  were at anchor desk, should have been at 3M.  We then got behind on the next stories - so didn't see the Voting FS or the team coverage frames.
D1 S: VOTE Stinger: Stinger didn't key - saw gray screen at end of stinger. Likely an Xpression issue - will reboot at 7pm.
Also - lots of issues with very slow Xpression today, include inability to see preview a couple of times and inability to drag graphics into rundown. Dalet was also extremely slow throughout the day.

Re: 11AM/Midday Live Discrepancy Report,"There are two separate Oscars Countdown issues:

column4: Stinger to the Countdown Fullscreen caused the Fullscreen to go to black.
The bug was counting down to the wrong time.
Update the Countdown Bug XPression Graphic to countdown to the correct time.
This package comes with a diversity BUGs that require different thinking. Bugs will fall into two categories.

column5: Bugs that run inside of a segment
Bugs that run for the whole show

column6: Requires coordination between Design and the Directors to have these bugs built, assigned a fixed ID, and have codes built and published.

column1: Broadcast Director  | ABC7 KGO-TV Bay Area
To: Stuerenberg, Shari M. (KGO-TV) <Shari.M.Stuerenberg@abc.com>; #KGO-TV DL-News Show Report <KGO-TV.DL-News.Show.Report@disney.com>; Rubin, Rick <Rick.Rubin@abc.com>
We had Oscars clock problem over the weekend… which was fixed.
Rick- can you look at this again?

A33 - a ""not live"" upper got deleted, which caused G1 to advance to the next thing. That's why we saw Adam Schiff's name baseline over the A33 VO clip ... and why the sound was a little late to roll. It knocked things out of whack a bit.
Friendly reminder: please @@@@ for the directors, when deleting uppers in the future. Thanks!

NOTE: The Oscars countdown bug is NOT counting down to the correct day/time. It says there are 7 days & some change left until Oscars Sunday, but it should be 6 days & some. Molly is going to follow up on this.
